definition: selfless model citizen, just like Lei Feng 雷鋒|雷锋[Lei2 Feng1]
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)

sentences.english: Each of the students wanted to be a live Lei Feng.
sentences.chinese: 每位学生都想成为活雷锋。

sentences.english: He is referred to as a living Lei Feng.
sentences.chinese: 他被称作是唯一活雷锋。

sentences.english: He is a Lei Feng in our class.
Williams has all of the tools for a small forward Thomas covets.
sentences.chinese: 小威同学全面的小前锋能力是活雷锋同志梦寐以求滴。

sentences.english: We all regard him as a living Lei Feng.

definition: Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes)/example/model/pacesetter
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
to abandon self for others (idiom); to sacrifice oneself to help the people/altruism
sb who tries to be on good terms with everyone
PLA military personnel who specialize in literary or artistic pursuits
